sentence.Network_en: Most of the people there are salt-of-the-earth, good, working-class people.
sentence.Network_cn: 那里的大多数人都是吃苦耐劳、心地善良的工人阶级。

sentence.Network_en: The new planet is about ten times the size of the earth.
sentence.Network_cn: 新发现的行星大约是地球的10倍那么大。

sentence.Network_en: The orbit of this comet intersects the orbit of the Earth.
sentence.Network_cn: 这颗彗星的轨道与地球的轨道交叉。

means.word_mean: 1. long-rooted morning glory of western United States
2. tropical American prostrate or climbing herbaceous perennial having an enormous starchy root; sometimes held to be source of the sweet potato
